description:
Good food, good service, very reasonably priced.

I come here regularly for breakfast and get Joanna's special: 3 eggs, bacon, toast, fruit, and coffee for under $10! 

Coffee is self serve.

I see a lot of people ordering the breakfast burrito and pastries, which look super yummy. I will definitely try them next time. Their salad bar and sandwiches look good, too, lots of options!

Definitely coming back.
author: J C.

description:
I've been here three times now & the customer service here is outstanding. I ordered lunch here via Seamless (GrubHub) & when I came in, my order wasn't on record. 
The owner (I believe) was very understanding & explained to me that they actually no longer partner with Seamless (I don't think he was aware that Seamless had not removed them from their restaurant offerings...they are still listed on Seamless even as I write this). 
He didn't make me feel like a jerk, he just made my sandwiches right away :)

Customer service in food service is going the way of the dinosaur, but it is alive & thriving at Sweet Joanna's, thank you!
author: Anna D.

description:
Really solid sandwiches for lunchtime. My go-to is usually the Reuben, but their salad bar is pretty good if you're not feeling sandwiches. Prices are pretty reasonable and comparable with other sandwich shops in the area, but I think the sandwiches are a little better here than what you could get elsewhere. 

Service can be kind of slow even during the lunch hour.
author: Tien L.

description: I always get their rare roast beef sandwich on Dutch crunch.  Delicious but it's not really super cheap though.
author: Kev H.

description: If your looking for a small home town feeling cafe this is the cafe for you. Great customer service and the prices for their food is very affordable for anyone. Their organic Guatemala coffee is my favorite. Food is very good and eclectic they have a little bit of everything. Please stop by and order Joanna's special for breakfast it's light and healthy .
author: Joshua R.

description:
I ordered the steak and cheese sub with no onions, or jalapeños, but it came with both. I also showed up after well after pickup time, they hadn't even started it, and they weren't even busy. Just a lack of attention to detail, and proper management. 
Also, they were skimpy on the meat.
author: Andy A.

description: Excellent breakfast choices. Definitely grab a blueberry muffin if you're lucky to find warm ones. Loads of blueberries, moist, and not overly sweet.
author: Kristen S.

description:
My new favorite lunch spot. 

Bomb sandwiches that are inexpensive and a great salad bar!

Fast service.
author: Dan R.

description:
MealPal: It was supposed to be a Mediterranean chicken wrap but turned out to be a very plain chicken wrap with nothing Mediterranean about it whatsoever. Here's what was in it:

- Chicken: Very dry. Very plain. 
- Lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers
- NO hummus, as advertised on MealPal. No sauce of any sort. 

The entire thing was pretty unsatisfactory. There was just no flavor. 

Plus, as other reviewers have mentioned, they don't wear gloves while making sandwiches and wraps. 

Final note: I arrived toward the tail end of my pickup time slot and they had not made the wrap yet. It was just five minutes for them to make it, but this falls short of expectations when using MealPal. Having your lunch ready for you to pick up is kind of the point.
author: Alice L.

description:
Love the Lox bagel - it's my go-to treat for those work days when I'm craving something special for breakfast! A huge assortment of delicious coffee flavors as well.

Staff is also always very friendly and accommodating, which is a huge a plus to the awesome selection of goodies!
author: Rebecca L.

description: The meatball sandwich on dutch crunch bread was AHHHMAZING!
author: Lauren M.

description: Good spot for breakfast sandwiches. Generous heap of fluffy eggs. Nothing gourmet or artisanal but good old fashion basic style.
author: Victor W.

description:
In this area, there are only a handful of decent lunch places.  I had the California Club on focaccia.  It was the perfect mix of fresh focaccia, avocado, pulled chicken and cheese.  At $8.50, this sandwich was a decent value.  

The lines to order, wait, and pay were a little confusing.  People are just crowded around the order line so you don't know if they're waiting to order or waiting to pick up.  I think that was the only downside of the restaurant.  Other than that, it's a good sandwich.
author: Richard T.

description: This places gets the three stars for the quality food, not really their service. You will be waiting for a time, so start text messaging whoever you need to do, or get some work done for 5-10 minutes while your sandwitch is being made. The people what make your sandwitch are not exactly the friendliest people around, looks like they chat with each other while sometimes ignoring a waiting customer (like me). Best to order ahead of time and just walk over to pick your food up.
author: Peter F.

description: I like this place! For almost everything: coffee with a co-worker (that's not as packed as Starbucks), picking up a batch of cookies for your team, a quick quality sandwich or fresh salad, or a selfie with the giant Pinocchio behind the counter.
author: Matheson J.

description:
Great homemade sandwiches.  I had the California club and was great and big portion.  They have a salad bar for other options too.  Also reasonably priced.

Rgds
author: Chris M.

description: They have dutch crunch bread, and that is all you need to know. The staff is very nice, and they make good subs. They also have a nice salad bar and you can go crazy there.
author: Donald P.

description:
This place has been good for in person orders, but I called ahead to place an order for pick up and they messed it up in a big way. I am lactose intolerant and ordered a soy latte, I confirmed three times that they used soy milk, but when I got back to my office I realized they had not use soy milk. I did NOT feel good...i had also ordered a bagel and cream cheese and there was seriously a half a tablespoon of creamcheese on the bagel, it was basically just toasted bread. I should have taken a picture, it was pathetic. 

To be fair, the green monster smoothie is tasty.
author: Daria B.

description:
Come here early if you want to get the popular roast turkey sandwich. I've never had it, but that's because I can't come here without getting the chicken salad sandwich with Dutch crunch. SO GOOD! The soup here is self-serve and pricey for just average soup. I'd say stick to the sandwiches instead of the self-serve deli stuff. Also, if you can, try their dessert pastries, which I think often get overlooked; they're located behind the pay counter.

Tip: The way the lines work here is kind of confusing. There's a line for ordering sandwiches, and there's another line where, after ordering and receiving your delicious hand-prepped sandwich, you tell the guy what you ordered and pay for it.
author: Celia K.

description: I've been here for breakfast a couple times and its a solid venue for bagels and breakfast sandwiches/burritos.
author: Rod M.

description:
Lovely lunch option. Never crowded, filling, and you walk on tree-lined streets on the way there. Made my Monday lunch feel like a Sunday stroll.

They didn't have to but they made me an off-menu sandwich. Very affordable at 7.95 a sandwich. This might be my new go-to place.
author: Quinn N.

description:
Their Italian Meatball sub is to die for! Hands down the best sandwich I have ever eaten. The ingredients taste very fresh and the bread is amazingly soft. 

This place is a great lunch destination if you work or live in the area.
author: Tuvshin T.

description: They are the nicest. And usually have muffins made in house that are delicious. They are my go to- happy to support them.
author: Debbie T.

description: This is the best option in the FiDi for breakfast. Bagel prices and variety are great, service is friendly and quick, and - if you want to splurge - that fresh squeezed OJ is the real deal! I appreciate the variety of offerings and have never had a bad tasting snack. The salad bar looks very good, but it is just out of range for me for lunch. Walking to my office from the Transbay Terminal, however, this spot is a perfect stop in the morning.
author: Lara W.

description:
A very cute, very clean little cafe - an awesome place to grab a coffee, tea, pastry, or lunch. The salad bar looked incredibly fresh and had lots of options (including house-made hummus, falafel, slaw, tons of veggies and more).

The interior space is good for getting some work done or for meeting up with colleagues or friends. And most importantly, it is MUCH less busy than the Starbucks nearby - so you can find a table!
author: Catie F.

description: Well, the food is still great here but they still have a horrible pickup system. "California club!" 5 people go for the sandwich. Chaos ensues.
author: Mark S.

description:
Reasonably priced breakfast and lunch sandwiches which are pretty tasty.

Sandwiches are fresh and the place has  a count with all types of fixings.

Definitely worth a try if your in the mood for a sandwich...
author: Steven W.

description: Great place to grab a tasty sandwich. This place is very conveniently located across from my office so whenever I need to grab a quick and tasty lunch, this is now my go to spot.  I only have ordered their tuna melt, with spinach instead of lettuce, which is delish.  The portions are big and satisfying.  I will try their salad bar soon.
author: V B.

description: I turned down the half price day old croissants in Speciality's to search for fresh croissants. Instead I got a full price chocolate croissant in Sweet Joanna's which was really dry and certainly tasted day old.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Nice spot to grab a sammie or some salad.

(+) Dutch crunch=solid! Crunchy yet doesn't hurt the roof of my mouth.
(+) orangina :)
(+) doesn't seem to get too packed during lunch hour, plenty of seating
(+) friendly owner
(-) chicken in my sammie tasted a bit dry + flavorless even with the pesto

There's two separate lines for ordering + paying. I think I'll come back to try the highly acclaimed turkey :)
author: Jenny Q.

description:
Great bagels, great lox, great cream cheese, all as stand alone products. It's as if a pizzeria excelled in bread, sauce and cheese (which does not exist on this planet, don't you freaking lie to me). Together it's arguably the best lox and cheese bagel in SOMA.

Coffee is solid, staff and owner friendly (they've been there for years). 

The very definition of a local neighborhood spot.
author: Rod A.

description:
So nice to find another great sandwich shop near my office at Howard and Fremont. Sweet Joanna's is tucked at the corner of Howard and Spear, in the old (and beautiful) Folger Coffee Building. They have a sandwich counter with all of the fresh ingredients, and a great salad bar with hummus, artichoke hearts, and the like.

I've had the roasted eggplant on foccaia, which is fantastic. The soft and warm eggplant and cheese goes so well with the crunchy fresh bread. I love that all sandwiches comes with sprouts, and it's just about as close to a perfect portion as you're gonna find: filling but not over the top. I've also had the egg salad sandwich, which is great for hot days. They also have created a warm and cozy atmosphere for a block that often is dominated by bus noise and traffic with their tables, cushions, and outdoor seating. Sandwiches run from 6 to 8 dollars.
author: Marcel M.

description:
A so so deli shop located near the Embarcadero Bart stop. I got the eggs, bacon and toast plate for about $8. It came with a cup for coffee which was nice.

The eggs weren't that great. The scrambled eggs looked a bit too fluffy (consistency was not good). Their bacon was crunchy but looked microwaved. The fruit they had on the side was decent.

Food was OK. Nothing special, don't think I will be back anytime soon.
author: Danielle C.

description: Been going to Sweet Jo's for lunch for years, and it never disappoints. Good quality and fresh bread and meat, especially the roast turkey which is made daily. Great staff and owner. Breakfast is solid too with warm, fresh muffins. Despite the "chaos" of picking up your sandwich that others have described (because they don't take names), I have never had a problem. (And I have been going to this place since some of those reviewers were in elementary school.) The workers know who they are making a sandwich for. This is not really a "call ahead" kind of place, so don't do it. They are great for catering an office breakfast or lunch too, as long as it is nearby.
author: Troy D.

description: I got the tuna salad sandwich on Dutch crunch. Although, such a standard sandwich choice, I give  it 2/5 because I was deceived by their sandwich pricing: a sandwich costs $6.95 and $7.95 but with addition of cheese it's an extra $1. Not cool. Who asks for a sandwich with no cheese; does a burrito shop up-charge their customers a $1 for adding cheese. Cheese is a basic component of a sandwich as it is to a burrito.
author: Alex G.

description:
I came here to Sweet Joanna's because the Toaster Oven was closed.  It was 8am and their door was still locked...I was hungry and was in a hurry to get to work.  Whoever was supposed to open was behind schedule!

I decided to go across the street and try their competitor, Sweet Joanna's, and got myself the Napoli foccacia sandwich that came with egg, cheese, and avocado.  The cafe is somewhat small with a handful of seats and offering espresso drinks and some especially fresh baked goods like muffins and cookies prominently displayed near the register.

With so much competition nearby for breakfast and lunch business, I want to give business to the places that can get me what I want and send me on my way and I think Sweet Joanna's deserves a thumbs-up just for the fact that they are friendly and serve a good breakfast sandwich.
author: Ben H L.

description: THEY DO NOT WEAR GLOVES WHILE MAKING FOOD!!! And the towels near them are soaked in bleach! My sandwich tasted like chemicals so gross. They refunded my money. Never going back. Bleh.
author: Azin A.

description: I came in here for a very quick bagel and cream cheese. I paid and waited and waited and waited. There are four people behind the counter, two men and two women. And they were just standing there without a care in the world. I guess when the cat is away the mice will play. Cold stares from me and nothing, I doubt the cashier even printed out my order. I had a meeting and had to rush out. Honestly if you need someone to constantly harass you to tell you to do your job which I have noticed the owner doing this isn't the right career choice for you. And as a customer I shouldn't have to remind you of my order. And on a health note one of the guys was cleaning the counter with a dirty rag and didn't wash his hands after, no way am I having him touch my bagel.
author: dina L.

description: I go to school in the adjoining building, and I love stopping by this place for a cup of coffee or sandwich. They have a deal with USF students that you can receive a free coffee with a breakfast item, or soda with a sandwich. The staff are all very friendly and they tend to remember you. They have so many options for coffee from the classic french roast to guatemala, and flavoured varieties. Never had a bad meal here.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Sweet Joanna's is a nice mom and pop shop
It's in the middle of Soma so don't forget to stop
The menu is simple, the food is pretty good
it's my go to cafe in this part of the hood

The wait staff are nice, the owner is buff
he's pretty huge, looks like he might have used some stuff (j/k, don't hurt me :)
The place is clean, the ambiance is nice
Lastly, the one great thing about this place is the price!

I like this place, it's not a bad joint to have breakfast at.  The place is relatively busy, steady stream of folks go in and out.  Because of that there are plenty of seats.  The breakfast has good selection of the all american kind, though one thing I'll say, for a place in the city their prices are great!   I just saw their lunch menu, and will need to try them out in the afternoon.
author: Dennis K.

description: Affordable, hot/cold sandwiches in Ricon hill with allllll of the toppings. Fresh deli meats and the wait isn't too bad if you avoid going between noon and 1pm.
author: Irina P.

description: Ordered a simple breakfast burrito with sausage, but I got back to my office and unwrapped a breakfast burrito with bacon. You can't make those kind of mistakes during the commute hours.
author: Matt F.

description:
By far the BEST place in the city. 
+1 for the delicious sandwiches. I've tried the chicken supreme, cheese steak, and California club. And every time I eat a sandwich it tastes better than the one before. 
+1 for the cleanliness of the place. I've never seen a cafe of this neatness. So GREAT job guys. 
+1 for the friendliness of the staff. They greet you with a smile and the owner is very sweet

+1 and if I can give all 5 stars to the salad bar and how inviting it is, I would absolutely do that. I have never seen a clean crumb-free salad bar like this one. 
+1 for the mushroom and garlic salad. It's by far my favorite. It's light and full of flavor 

We will definitely come again every time we get the chance
author: Dyma K.

description: Good place to grab a sandwich or salad during lunch. Looks like they've got a good amount of seating and pastries and coffee for the morning.
author: Will D.

description:
Joanna is one of those 6s that thinks she's a 10, which brings her down to a 2.

Point blank, service sucks. Sandwich makers have an arrogant attitude like you're lucky they are serving you - been here a few times, not a one time judgment. 

There is no clear direction where to order and where to pay, so it's usually a shit show at busy times. The staff look at you like you're an idiot if you ask for clarification. 

Food is average at best. If you're down with a knot of deli meat on some soggy bread you might think she's the one for you...
author: Brandon G.

description: Great spot for brunch! I used the Whirl app (getwhirl.com) and got two free meals! Prices are reasonable and Amin and the staff are always happy to help. I usually go for the salad bar in the afternoon but their coffees are on point too and made with more love than Starbucks across the street *drumfill*
author: Iman P.

description:
Just came here and paid with a $20, but received change as if I paid with a $10.

Right after I paid (which he didn't call the bill, btw), the cashier threw the bill into a jumble of cash, rearranged it and put it back in the cash register.  Then when I inquired why my change was so low, he justified it saying he "had no twenties".  A restaurant during the lunch hour rush has no $20's? Obvious lie.

Enjoy dishonest people working on your FOOD? Methinks not.
Stay far away.
author: Erica D.

description:
I have a mad hankering for Sweet Jo's roasted eggplant sandwich.  And I've never even tried the darn thing!!

Sweet Jo's is great for their sandwiches.   I've tried many from their Hot Pastrami to their Chicken Salad to the California Club.  I like the toppings they offer and appreciate that my Dutch Crunch is always crunchy.  Recently I'd been told by more than one person how amazing their roasted eggplant sandwich is, but every time I've ordered one, they're sold out!  We'll see if this lives up to its hype if I ever get my hands on one.
author: Mel T.

description: We order a lot from Sweet Joannas.  Nice fresh sandwiches!!
author: Annie A.

description:
I work nearby and on certain days I want to have something comforting at lunch. And when I do, I come to Sweet Joanna's.

This place is always kept clean. The salad bar is always tidy, appetizing and hygienic. The sandwiches are super awesome. I usually tend to go with the tuna melt or just the tuna salad on wheat with provolone. For a huge sandwich, $6.45 is really affordable. They also have a very popular turkey carved sandwich which goes fast. So, come early to not miss it.

Service is always friendly and definitely a place to come back.
author: Rika P.

description: A friend recommended this place, which  is  nicely tucked on the Howard and spear intersection. Grabbed a Chicken salad sandwich for lunch here. It was  great and the size is humongous. Would love go back to try other sandwiches.
author: Mrugen D.

description:
This place is a solid 3 stars, 4 on a good day.

I've tried a few things from this place as it is across the street from where I work.  

Breakfast burrito - not bad, not amazing...it will fill you up in a hurry

Reuben sandwich - very filling but meat tasted old and it wasnt that hot, I would have left it in the oven a bit longer.

Turkey Sandwich - good, turkey was fresh

The salad bar is ok...it has a variet of fresh veggies and a few hot dishes...I wouldn't try anything as it looks like its been exposed and sitting out for a while.

Did not liket hat they scored low on their health score either.

Staff is great...owner is kinda a big mouth type.
author: Samantha S.

description:
If you want a really gigundo sandwich, go here.  I got the California club.  There was so much turkey meat, I could barely finish half the sandwich.  I packed it up and took it back to my desk at work and ate the rest about 3 hours later.  

The quality of the turkey meat was fresh, as if pulled straight off a Thanksgiving turkey.  It wasn't salty either, so it was pretty good.  It

The line can get confusing, as there's limited space inside.  But you can figure it out easily enough.

I'd definitely come back.  Come very hungry because gigundo sandwich!
author: Marc E.

description:
Don't worry, people!  Sweet Joanna's is coming back next week.  I work just a block away, and I was told that they are closing just for ONE week, because of the BART strike.  The Owner uses BART to get to work. 

The California Club sandwich with Bacon will be back!
author: Toby C.

description: Came by during lunch and order the triple decker club. Waited about 15 mins for my order, not bad at all. Sandwich itself wasn't that amazing. It was actually too big to eat/had to cut it down to fit in my mouth. The avocado on the sandwich wasn't rule at all, it was crispy. :-( Decent place but wouldn't go out of my way to come again.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I'm really picky when it comes to Financial District food. Everything here is usually grossly overpriced and mediocre at best. How happy was I to finally try this place out!

For under $8, you get a huge sandwich that absolutely melts in your mouth. I had the Roasted Turkey on Dutch Crunch and my oh my...the bread was perfectly crispy, and the tomato, lettuce, avocado created a sweet combination. 

Never again will I have to ban Financial District food!
author: Mina K.

description: Very slow, went in for a bagel it it took them about fifteen minutes to get it out. Bagel was so-so and had way too much cream cheese. You can do better almost anywhere else.
author: Virginia S.

description:
Solid sandwich, they do not skimp on anything, everything was fresh.  I had a pastrami sandwich.  

They have a salad bar, indoor and outdoor seating.

TIp:  They charge extra for cheese if the sandwich doesn't already come with it.  They asked what kind of cheese I wanted and I was unaware it was extra, not a huge deal, but now I know.  It would have nice if they mentioned that it was extra.

That being said, I'll go back.
author: Ty C.

description: Never disappointed.... I tried this time the mushroom Salad and OMG it was out of the world and could not leave without my favorite cheese steak, the best I ever had in my life :)
author: Tareq M.

description:
I've been here about ten times at this point. I always get their hot sandwiches so I can't comment on their salads or baked goods.

Service is always friendly and the sandwiches are always consistently good. Generally i go for the roast turkey so that i can fall asleep during afternoon meetings.
author: Ken W.

description:
Love this place!

I work next door and have a hard time going anywhere else for my sandwiches!  They don't skimp on the meat and the sandwich makers are pleasant and have NEVER gotten my order wrong.  The Roast Beef on Dutch Crunch is tops!

I've also had their breakfast sandwiches and it's hard to beat the Most Wanted (with sausage on Focaccia bread).

I'm a loyal customer and have converted most of my co-workers into Sweet Joann-ians!
author: Nick W.

description:
YUM. This is by far the best sandwich spot in the neighborhood. The 'chefs' are super friendly and can remember amazing amounts of special orders on any sandwich -- it's always perfect, quick and affordable. Perfect combo for a quick work lunch -- and they cater. 

I love the Veggie Sandwich and they make a great falafel wrap!

Now, why are you still eating Specialties?
author: Gretchen S.

description:
Had a 20minute Chair Massage next door during the first part of my Wednesday Lunch at Rincon Chriopractic, and came out HUNGRY!  And in the mood for something healthy to go with my new found relaxed shoulders.

I was intrigued by the small yet through salad bar with a Mediterranean twist that sets it apart from the loads of salad bars in FiDi.  

I don't do salad dressing, but my lettuce tasted great with cherry tomato, corn, humus (was a bit salty), tabbouleh, and some pickled kidney bean and chick pea thing.  Also I like that they separate the fruits in fruit salad so you can avoid the melon easily (not a huge fan of melon...)  My small square container cost me around $4.  

My splurge lemon bar was heavy on the crust and the lemon was heavy on the sugar, but hey it satisfied my lemontastic craving for $2.

I guess while I think this place is good and a bit original, I can not see going back unless I am in the area and it is convenient, since I don't eat sandwiches and the salad bar is my draw.
author: Susan C.

description:
First I must ask myself...why have I not rated this place before?  I have been eating here for years, but I guess there's no time like the present!  

I will first say that, for the price, you cannot get a better sandwich in this neck of the woods!  The meat and produce are always fresh and the bread is always nice and soft.  

The salad bar is also very nice.  It always features tasty hummus and falafel as well as a lot of other yummy salad fixins.  The service is also very welcoming.  The owner is very sweet and makes the environment very nice.  

I have brought friends here and they all say the same thing..."this place rocks"...So, if you are looking for a tasty salad or sandwich for a great price, check out Sweet Joanna's and say hi to Amin for me!    

Oh yeah, they accept Level Up too!
author: Rebecca M.

description: One of my favorite mid-week lunch spots - the chicken supreme is delicious and their macaroons are the biggest and best I've ever had!
author: David P.

description:
Another messed up order today.  There's no numbering system when you order, so someone else will take your sandwich order when they shout what's ready.
Boo.  Not worth the hassle of dealing with three people reaching for a sandwich claiming they were there before you.
author: Kev M.

description: This place is legit. When you order a chicken sandwich you get actual pieces of chicken straight off the bone, not processed (though some of their sandwiches do use what looks like sliced deli meat -- so look carefully). I've also had the breakfast burritos which are some of the best in the area. If there's not a line when you go in, there will be shortly. While small, it stays pretty busy. No worries though because they are pretty fast at getting you your food. It's not the most ideal for a sit down breakfast, but for something quick or to-go this is your place. Highly recommend checking it out.
author: Bryan R.

description: I never knew that Sweet Joanna's existed but on a walk through downtown yesterday I saw them and thought I'd check them out.  I ordered the meatball sandwich and it was really good.  A perfect amount of cheese in there too.  The only drawback was that it took a little while to actually prepare but it was worth it.
author: Blake B.

description:
Popped in here for coffee and a pastry this morning and the "manager" refused to take my credit card because the total was under $5. Hello, it's the 21st Century - who carries cash? And who wants to carry coins when you get change?

If you accept credit cards, you accept credit cards.

Fail - and I won't be back.
author: Bill E.

description: The salad bar area is nice and quick and you pay by the oz. When I went, there were two hot food items: potato and BBQ chicken and a good selection of salad items: salads, veggies, corn, falafel, boiled egg, sliced pepper, green beans, etc. The sandwich and counter area on the other hand was a cluster f-ck. It was my first time visiting so I had no clue where to go for what. In case you don't know, you go to the sandwich area at the back, order a sandwich, pay at the register at the front, then wait for your sandwich. I'm not sure how they know whose sandwich is whose since they don't take names or numbers.. but you can just stand there and hope that your item comes out and no one takes it or you don't take someone else's. Hot sandwiches are even slower to make, so if you're in a hurry, your best bet is a regular sandwich or straight to the salad bar.
author: Grace L.

description:
Let's just say- best sando in all of FiDi/ SOMA (if you ask me).  Extremely friendly staff, friendly owner, and delicious warm gorgeous sandwiches for days.  I'm a frequent 2 times a week visitor and would be here daily if I could.

I'm a very picky sandwich eater/ rater, especially in San Francisco/ Bay Area (top choice being Little Lucca's in Burlingame), yet Sweet Jo's has so much potential.

What can I say-- 
dutch crunch? check
freshness? check
delicious fresh roasted turkey (not that deli meat crap)? check
warm sandwich for no additional cost? check mate

I'll leave at this, get the california club on dutch crunch and you wont be disappointed .  Or Don't, and leave it for me!

Bring on the challenge?
author: ilya g.

description:
Every sandwich at this place is solid, from Chicken Salad to hot meatball or BBQ sandwiches to a very basic Turkey and Cheddar. I've once had their salad bar - I prefer going to Rincon for this because they have more ingredients that I like - and it was very fresh as well. 
 
The owner? is super nice and has offered late in the day discounted macaroons to me in the past. I've noticed that he'll flirt a little more on certain days when I'm better dressed than others :) The ladies are also efficient, although every once in awhile I'll ask for a particular ingredient that they ran out of or forgot to put out and they get a bit huffy when they have to go get more. I think this is what ultimately keeps me from giving them the five star mark, but I still enjoy going here for lunch and snacks!
author: Alita M.

description:
TURKEY SANDWICH ON DUTCH CRUNCH. 

Those are the only words you need to know for Sweet Joanna's.  

Short lines. Speedy service. Amazing sandwich. (I've only had the turkey, so I can't really comment on the other items on the menu)

Upon arriving back in the break room to enjoy my lunch, I had ooh's and ahh's for the meal I was about to dive into.  Real turkey (you can pick white or dark meat) and did I mention there are not long lines? 

I have to be careful not to eat the entire sandwich in one sitting because it. causes. reduced. productivity...
author: Lisa L.

description:
I am on the hunt for a great breakfast burrito near my office downtown. Although the price is right and the ingredients fresh, the tortilla was awful. Chewy and stale. The salsa, watery and store bought. I believe there is never a reason to use store bought pico de gallo, fresh tomatoes, onions,  and jalapeno. So easy. I dont think I will be going back for a breakfast burrito but I may give them a second chance for lunch. 

On the plus side it is a great location and staff are very friendly.
author: Hidegrl A.

description: Great little sandwich shop. It's hard to pick out one thing that a great because pretty much everything is. The one exception is their coffee. Go here do sandwiches, scones, etc. DON'T go here for coffee.
author: Zach H.

description: I used to go here for the breakfast muffins when I worked nearby.  The muffins were huge - fresh and delicious, too.  I never tried the sandwiches or salads, but everything looked and smelled good to me.  Cute little place.
author: Lawree S.

description: Good bang for your buck, $8 can get you a massive sandwich with fresh ingredients. I got the triple decker - three layers of turkey, avocado, sprouts and tomato and red onion on whatever bread you like. I had to remove some turkey in order to finish it and boy am I full. Nice people and high quality!
author: Sonya Z.

description: I've been going here for about 10 years. The food is pretty good and the prices are reasonable.  The owner is usually in and he's a pretty nice guy. I recommend the breakfast burrito. Great salad bar.
author: Nick C.

description: Great sandwiches if you are in the SOMA hood.  My favorite place for a falafel or a hot turkey sandwich.  The sandwich is the size of your head AKA a good thing when you are hungry.  I've been on a pastrami kick lately so try the hot pastrami with spicy mustard as well
author: Robert H.

description:
Just an update to Nick O's comment: Joanna's was closed for just 1 week but now they're open again. 

Great lunch spot. The salad bar/buffet looks great but I haven't been able to pull myself away from ordering one of their hot sandwiches every time I go in here. Just a heads up: the hot sandwiches take a few more minutes to prepare so if you're in a hurry maybe think about other options.
author: Billy H.

description: Very solid sandwich! Great portions as they aren't stingy on the meat (at least on the 3 sandwiches I've had)...but it's not your cheapest sandwich. Make sure you get your sandwich toasted. It'll make it that much tastier.
author: Tim w.

description:
Usually decent but watch out for muffins. I asked if they were made fresh this morning.  Oh yes, she replied!  Get to my office and still cold from fridge. Not paying good money for a stale, cold muffin.  
Happened too many times, I'm done with them.
author: Brian B.

description:
I work around the corner from Sweet Joanna's and I love going here for my sandwich fix. I usually go for the tuna salad sandwich - it's the perfect tuna salad. Not too dry but not too watery. I love that it comes with a lot already on the sandwich, especially the sprouts!

I've yet to try the roasted turkey because they're always out when I get there, which is usually around 1. One of these days I'll get it!

The salad bar is decent as well, the mac and cheese is the best in it. However, I'd stick to the sandwiches.

Also, there's a $5 minimum for credit cards!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Reasonable price for an amazing sandwich.

CLEANLINESS: 4/5
SERVICE: 4/5
FOOD: 5/5
- Fresh Roasted Turkey Sandwich on Dutch Crunch ($6.95)

Came here with a coworker for the first time, and she recommended the turkey sandwich here. Boy, was that a good choice. Turkey tends to be dry, but this place has some pretty darn good turkey. The meat was moist and full of flavor. I had mine toasted with provolone cheese (+50 cents). The best part was that they toasted it, so it was warm! The sandwich is pretty big, so it's definitely worth the price.

The only negatives about this place was the long wait for the sandwich. Also, they DON'T HAVE A RECYCLING BIN! I'm not a crazy "Go-Green" type of person, but recycling bins are not hard to get and will definitely keep customers who are environmentally-conscious. It felt weird to throw my soda can away. =X.

Anywho, this place is definitely worth checking out. I've only had the turkey sandwich, so I'm not sure how the other sandwiches tastes. If you get the turkey, you can't go wrong!
author: Desmond C.

description:
Sweet Joanna's is right. It's fresh, it's fast, it's delicious. I just dusted a chicken salad sando worth dreaming about. If you are downtown and are in need of that one place you can go and get an AMAZING sando exactly the way you want it ( they have jalapenos for your sando, by the way), Sweet Jo's is it. 
the Latin music being played is definitely a bonus as well. 

cant wait to try the salad bar. 

i also picked up a fresh rice crispy treat and diet peach Snapple. 

lunch perfection.
author: Cameron M.

description: Used my Gopago credit here today - Turkey, bacon, avocado and all the fixings on dutch crutch and warmed up. Filling. Happy. Stomach. yay!
author: Julie F.

description:
3/5 lunch i guess...

don't really venture SOMA for lunch, seems like an eternity from my office in...NOMA?

anyways, just want to comment on the salad bar. few selections, but i do appreciate the fact that the caesar wasn't too shabby. usually something so standard goes by the wayside, but it was good here, even for a serve-yourself salad bar.
author: Alvin D.

description: Best sandwich I have found in the area.  The California club is AMAZING!  And the prices are very reasonable.
author: Alex R.

description:
THE GOOD: The sandwiches (especially the hot ones) are really tasty, big and well priced. I would specifically recommend the California Club (hot fresh roasted turkey, avo, bacon and cheese). The thing is monster sized, and so good I found myself licking my fingers (to the horror of my lunch date). The salad bar is also a good option for those inclined.

THE BAD: The line can be a bit long (and slow to move).
author: Robin S.

description:
Great food, reasonably priced, super friendly staff, and the lines arent too long during the lunch rush. What else could you want?

I've had the meatball sub and the reuben and both are delicious. Looking forward to trying something new and going back!
author: Julian Q.

description:
Cameron M. called it with the Latin music. Boom.

I end up at the SJ more often than not (with Cameron in tow) because I know that, more often than not, there will be no line. Although I always walk in intending to try a sando (frequent buyer card, what's UP) I'm always lured in by the salad bar.

Hummus? Yes.
Falafel? Yes.
Caesar salad that ROCKS? Yes.
Greek salad that also rocks? Also yes.
Occasional mushroom/eggplant/bean concoction? I will always try it.
Baked goods that smell like heaven? Yes.

I typically end up with a 2 lb salad that costs me $14 and stuffing myself silly. Go me.
author: Amanda F.

description:
A financial district staple.  Boom, I said it.

Unmatched service combined with a large array of sandwiches makes Nick a happy camper.  Sweet Jo's can turn an 11-hr work day into...well, an awesome-try-not-to-food-coma 11-hr work day.  I love the Turkey ABC and basically anything on their Dutch Crunch bread.

The owner/manager (not sure) was nice enough to even let me convert $2 on my card to $2 for the bus ride home (before I got a Clipper).

Sweet Jo's was my first lunch spot working in SF and will continue to been my weekly spot until I leave.
author: Nick W.

description:
Update 9.07

I ordered a Philly Cheesesteak and when I got back to my office I couldn't eat it. I had to go back and get a refund. They put Jalepeno peppers in the meat and I'm allergic to most peppers. My stomach hurt from the smell of them. I wish they had put it on the menu that it has this mixed in.

------

I checked this place out because I searched Yelp for Falafels nearby and this came up located on the other side of my block. I was aiming for the fresh daily roasted turkey, but the guy in front of me ordered it and they were all out at 1:30pm on Wednesday afternoon. I ordered a Spinach Pie instead. The menu on the wall said $3.50, but Mr. Cashier rang me up and it was $3.80. I should have asked about the price difference, not that 30 cents is a big deal, but it's nice to know what I'm paying an extra quarter + nickel for, right? 

I started eating this Spinach Pie and it's yum, a little more sour than I had not expected it to be, but if it's Mediterranean style then, it should have a lot of that sour lemony taste I'd say.

Half way done, I can't figure out why I keep tasting and smelling pickles and onions, "OH LOOK! There is a stack of pickles, onions, and tomatoes on a leaf of romaine hiding underneath the pie slices." I would have said "no" to all of them if I had known, I don't like pickles, raw onions or tomatoes. It's okay. I still like my Spinach Pie.

I would go back, earlier though, so I can try the fresh daily roasted turkey.
author: Lorrie N.

description:
I'm rating this only for the salad bar... I have not tried their sandwiches yet. 

Salad bar is super small.... There isnt a great selection.  Tried their acclaimed ceasar... it was okay too.  This place is super pricey for a salad... mine always comes out to be 12 bucks and I only put one egg and the rest are spinach, lettuce, cucumbers and bell peppers.  WTH?!  

Probably wont come back here for the salad bar... but maybe try their sandwiches..
author: Vicky T.

description:
The best sandwich place ever! They're large - often big enough for me to eat half now, and half later. My favorite sandwich: the fresh roast turkey. It's better than thanksgiving day!

As for catering, they brought in good sandwiches but the desserts/pastries weren't that great. If you want something sweet, order from another place, like Specialty's, but get your sandwiches from here!
author: Apple P.

description:
This is my go-to sandwich shop! I love their roast turkey sandwiches (yes, they actually ROAST a turkey daily) - it's like Thanksgiving on a sandwich. When I don't order the roast turkey I usually have toasted grilled chicken with pesto sandwich. 

The ingredients are always fresh and the staff is friendly (especially Amin). True, the lines can be long at lunch time at pretty much any place in the Financial District so a good time to stop in is before 11:40 to avoid a long wait.
author: Denee N.

description:
When I was a little kid, I used to try to sniff everything I was eating first, before putting it in my mouth.  My parents would tease me about it (wow, almost typed in "tase" - that would've been tragic), saying that I was like a puppy who followed my nose everywhere.  15 years later, that sharp nose has finally somewhat come in handy.

I'd just finished getting my hair cut at One Twenty for Hair, and I had about 15 minutes left on my meter.  Initially I had my eyes on the prize (a venti Chai Tea Latte) at Starbucks, but then all of a sudden, my sniffer caught a whiff of something MORE amazing: rotisserie chicken.  I didn't really know where it was coming from, but I knew that the only place that would have that delicious aroma at the intersection of Spear and Howard was Sweet Joanna's.

I walked in, and bingo, I was right.  The smell of roasted chicken was everywhere, and my eyes lighted right on the roasted chicken sandwich.  So I ordered one ($5.95) toasted on a wheat roll, complete with mayo, dijon mustard, pickles, tomatoes, onions and chicken.

I also asked what soups they had after not seeing it on their white board.  The owner came out and lifted the lids and told me that there was chicken tortilla and some other soup that didn't strike my fancy, so I went and got a cup of steaming hot soup for the cold day.

To my dismay, the chicken tortilla soup didn't have chicken, even though I dug through the tin and tried to look for even a smidgen of it.  It was tasty, but seriously, chicken?  The sandwich was also just okay; there wasn't much flavor to it overall, and the chicken was a bit dry and not the delicious hot rotisserie chicken that I was picturing when I smelled it.

$9.69 total for a decent lunch.  Minimum card amount is $5.  Next time I think I'll try the salad bar.
author: Tori S.

description:
My "go to" breakfast when the continental breakfast next door at the Big W is just not cutting it. 

Egg white and swiss on a poppy-seed bagel with a nonfat latte = heaven....

And they have an "A" rating for cleanliness. Phew!
author: Tam G.

description:
I stumbled across Sweet Joanna's on my way to a massage next door and was greeted by a delicious odor of food that I just had to grab something.

I was looking forward to getting a breakfast burrito, but it was past 12 and so I decided on the Triple Decker sandwich, which cost me about $7 and kept me full all day. I loved the sandwich! They also have a HUGE salad bar with two daily specials.

My sandwich was so huge and tasted absolutely delicious. The only reason I took a star off was because the guy who rang me up was rude. Well, excuse me for not realizing you are not serving breakfast anymore, jeez.
author: Surge C.

description: This place is great, the food, the service and everything, i always  get the chicken supreme i love it.
author: Steven S.

description:
I don't know where Joanna is but her cafe and all the kind people in it are totally awesome. This is really some of the finest quality lunch fare that you'll find in the area.  When you look over the sandwich counter at their heaps of delicious looking ingredients you'll find yourself wanting some magical combination of everything - pesto, cucumber, avocado, cheese, salsa, fajita, falafel - mmm. 
Their salad bar is also quite nice and they recently added dolmas - hallelujah!
author: Laura M.

description:
Sweet Joanna's Cafe is not sweet, not very good, and I don't like it.

I had lunch here recently and ordered the steak & cheese wrap expecting something similar to a philly cheese steak, but in the form of a wrap, and instead got a lumpy, roast-beef burrito like thing. How sad. I gave it a try anyway and it wasn't very good. I ended up drinking my juice for lunch and just staring at the wrap thing. Also, a friend picked some items from their salad bar and paid $9.00+ for a few measly leaves and some chicken. 

Totally not impressed.
author: Jenny T.

description:
I've only had their salad bar here but I think it's the best in the area. Although their selection is a bit more limited than places like Portico, the quality of their ingredients is far superior. 

Also, the seating here is so comfy and cozy- they have these cushy benches that run alongside the wall. You can get lost in conversation here for hours, especially because it's not overly crowded or loud.

I'm a fan!
author: Mariela D.

description:
I have to sing my praises for the California Club sandwich with real slices of turkey, the bomb salad bar with tender barbeque chicken, and scrumptious chewy yet crisp chocolate chip cookies.

This place is bananas, b-a-n-a-n-a-s! The name is Joanna's, J-o-a-n-n-a-s!

Small improvements to be made: More chocolate chips in the cookies, tap water tastes kinda funky, and corn and goat cheese for the salad bar. Regardless, definitely one of my lunching regulars.
author: Claire C.

description:
First two thoughts after finishing lunch:

1. That was an awesome BBQ chicken sandwich! So much chicken. So much BBQ sauce. So much veggie and wheat roll goodness.

2. Do I have BBQ sauce on my face?

Considering I was back in the office while eating, the second thought was probably the more important thought. A quick run to the mirror in the restroom confirmed the coast was clear. I'd chance it again for a sandwich this good.
author: Jason B.

description: I come here based on my coworkers' recommendations. I usually order breakfast here because my work location is so close by. Everyone is friendly and their breakfast items are delicious!! I suggest getting the breakfast burrito or the egg muffin. The only thing is they take their time making their food but it's totally worth it because the food tastes fresh! They also have a salad bar during lunch time--but stick with the sandwiches. Credit card minimum is $5. They also take Gopago credit.
author: Julie H.

description:
I didn't come here for lunch,but came here for a little breakfast one time.They have several breakfast specials going on and I decided to go with the : two eggs,bacon and toast.You have a choice between OJ or coffee ..I decided on getting some OJ.I thought the price overall was ok and my breakfast was prepared quickly and service was great.

If you don't feel like loading up on all the calories they offer muffins,crossiants and other baked goods too. I thought the place overall was clean and more than enough space to sit and enjoy.

P.S You can also see them prepare your food too,so that is another plus.
author: Dani D.

description:
Go for the 'Turkey ABC'
No complaints about the food or the seating area. The wait always seems a bit long, especially around the lunch hour. It's not uncommon to have 4-5 people standing around several minutes waiting for a sandwich to come out. About once a week, my desire for a Turkey sammie trumps my despise for lines and I head down to Sweet Joannas.
author: Dave S.

description: This place has great quality food and the staff is very nice. However, they cannot get a sandwich order right. A couple of years ago they kept messing up my sandwich order. I spoke with the owner a few times, even suggesting they use order forms so they get orders right. He made no changes. I kept going there until the fifth time they messed up my sandwich. They kept putting on onions and peppers when I very specifically asked them not to. I stopped going there for more than a year. There are plenty of other places nearby. So today I decided to give them another chance. I ordered a hot pastrami with lettuce , pickles and tomatoes. I get back to my desk and find there are peppers on my sandwich! They are absolutely terrible at getting a sandwich order right and have made no attempt to recognize the problem or fix it
author: Steve P.

description:
Located in the financial district (SOMA). They have a good variety of sandwiches. I love their tuna melt....it is so yummy. They also have fruit smoothies and freshly squeezed orange juice. During breakfast time they serve freshly baked muffins(I like the chocolate chip).

They also have lunch specials, but beware...they do run out of food and once the special is gone, it is gone.

The owner is always so friendly and he always says Hello. The staff is also friendly and they work fast. There is usually a line during lunch time, but it moves pretty fast.
author: Bernie T.

description:
Sweet Joanna's breakfast burrito is f-ing delicious. And it's only $3.95.

I would come back here solely for that.
author: Roy C.

description:
Mmmm Mmmm Mmm yummy!

I can guarantee you can get really yummy sandwiches here.  It's a great lunch to-go spot.  Whether you're looking for vegetarian or hearty meat sandwiches, Joanna's has all.  I haven't tried it yet, but I remember they have a salad bar and falafel wraps as well.

I've tried a Roast turkey and avocado on Dutch crunch and B.L.T. and both are just so good!  It takes a bit while to make but it's worth it.  Also, compare to what you have to pay at Subway or Quizno's, Joanna's sandwiches are way better quality with same or a bit more price.  Try it, you would want to go back there again.
author: Misty C.

description: Joanna's has become my go-to breakfast spot near the office. The women who work there are friendly, the eggs are *not microwaved* - fluffy and flavorful, and the muffins (recently had the banana nut) are melt-in-your-mouth pillows of deliciousness. I will be back here again and again when I need a change from my morning oatmeal.
author: Katelyn M.

description: Went to Sweet Joanna's Cafe today for a sandwich this afternoon.  I ordered the NY Pastrami & Swiss.  It was pretty good, but nothing amazingly special.  They put a lot of condiments in the sandwich, like mustard, mayo, lettus, tomato, pepperchinies, onions.  It wasn't the best meat, but everything else in there was pretty good.  They seem pretty busy so my guess is that most things on the menu are a step above the pastrami.  Service was good for how busy they were.  I'll be back to try other sandwiches from Sweet Joanna's Cafe.
author: Brian G.

description:
Sweet Joanna's is the best lunch spot near my work (Spear and Howard).  Their sandwiches are particularly delicious (and big enough to keep me full all day long).  The owner and employees are always friendly and responsive.

Anyway, I really don't have any complaints about this place.  Their food is very reasonably priced and often of higher quality than other nearby eateries.  What more could you ask for when you need a quick bite to eat near the office?
author: Raphael C.

description:
Update 3/20/07:  

It was raining today, but I decided to abandon the chaos of the company cafeteria.  Now I had a chance to try Sweet Joanna's during the lunch hour.  The place was crowded, despite the rain.  At least down here customers formed lines, and the lines were moving.  

It was a little chaotic behind the counter, but to their credit two clerks were preparing four sandwiches at a time.  I ordered a "club sandwich," which was more like a hoagie or a sub, Doritos and a Diet Pepsi for about $8.50.  "For here or to go" turned out to be a meaningless question.  

Six B&W photos by the front door entertained me with a record of the construction of the warehouse in 1904.  It's nice to know some 8-story brick structures withstand earthquakes.  

The upgrade to three stars is only in relation to the company cafeteria.  In dry air I would go elsewhere.  

---------------
Original review 3/1/07: 

A very tasty sandwich came my way a while back, courtesy of a colleague who didn't need a whole American-style lunch.  Research (on Yelp!) recently told me it was the turkey BAT sandwich from Sweet Joanna.  

So, today I watched a very interesting market close.  After 4:20pm EST I began to think about lunch.  Figure the market closes at 4:00, and with a 20-minute delay a lot of people are getting the closing price for free at 4:20, and then they have time to unwind and wrap their lips around a long-neck Corona or something.  So where do YOU think the term 420 comes from?  

But I digress.  At 2:15pm I walked into Sweet Joanna's, and looked over the menu.  They had an open salad bar.  They also had a beautiful, bright sandwich zone, with all kinds of fresh vegetables and tasty-looking meats.  I found the turkey BAT as the "California special" or something like that, and decided to order it.  

And they ignored me.  Like I was invisible or something.  Now, I could have spoken up and demanded some attention, but I had been standing there a few minutes, and three employees ignored me completely.  One was restocking.  One was talking on the telephone.  One was sort of wandering around aimlessly.  Hey, if a merchant doesn't want my money, who am I to force it on him?  

On to the next sandwich shop!  I'll get that tasty sandwich during a regular lunch hour when they're paying attention.
author: David D.

description:
This is my new favorite lunch spot.

Good quality food at good prices. The hot food and salad bar is always full of fresh and interesting choices, and at (I think) only $5 / pound, it's a hell of a bargain.

Generous and tasty hot sandwiches (meatball, meatloaf, gyros, turkey and more) are only $5.50, while cold sandwiches are just $4.95.

Breakfast is a super bargain too, with a variety of sandwich and platter options.

Bottom line is it's like going to Seller's Market but paying for Lee's.

As an extra bonus, there always seems to be a hottie (or three) there when I go. I'm just sayin.
author: Shawn S.

description: 5 stars is a little intense for a breakfast spot but they blueberry muffin's are well worth it. If you work downtown and need that carbohydrate before work this is the spot. The lunch sandwiches are also righteous.
author: Linda G.

description:
You saved yourself from one star because your sandwiches are good. They tend to rock my socks off for the most part. I love local deli sandwiches from local deli places.

Now, why only three stars?

It's funny...I read a few reviews from people that said "They really know how to cater a meal at the last minute." Oh...how funny...

HOW ABOUT CATERING A MEAL WITH ADVANCE NOTICE?! Cause you know what, they can't! I've been under stressed at least three times ordering from them, when I would call the owner the day before and he would "take down my order" only to have a blank look [OR NOT EVEN BE THERE AND THEREFORE NOT GIVE ANYONE THE MESSAGE!] when I go to pick up the food the day of the event. ACK! Once it was for a meeting with some uppity-ups and the CEO of my company. Not fucking cool to have me stressing over that jerks!

Don't claim to be all local and friendly, if you are not. It's just not cool.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
They roast a turkey every day in order to have the meat ready for the very best sandwich: the Turkey ABC 

fresh roast turkey, on a roll with Bacon and Cheese (the B&C)- put in the oven to get hot . .. it comes out gets dressed with tomato and lettuce, mustard, mayo, etc. . . and then gets a bit of the A- avocado

it is the best way to induce a coma at work 

and if the turkey abc isn't enough to do it, get a fresh giant rice krispy treat too

--
just a snarky side note and this is going to sound more mean than it is- but try to get the girls to make the sandwich instead of the owner's nephew. he doesn't have his heart in it and you can tell that in the sandwiches he makes
author: El T.

description:
Yes, they have one of the best roast turkey sandwiches.  My weakness: roast turkey (it is fresh roasted each day) on dutch crunch with bacon and cheese.  They toast it first, so it is warm and yummy.  then they put on some avocado and whatever other fixings  you want.  It is too much for lunch, so the other half makes a nice snack for my mid-afternoon munchie attack.  They also have a killer Reuben!

Don't go too late at lunch or they're likely to be out of a lot - this place is popular.
author: Greg R.

description:
Ooey yuck. Be sure to specify WHITE meat turkey if you're in to that sort of thing.  The turkey is pulled rather than sliced, so not possible to separate dark from white on my sandwich.

In the trash it goes.  Dang.

Will return to this review when I go again to see if I can get white meat only.
author: Becky S.

description:
I don't love Sweet Joanna's primarily for the bonding I do with the owner, who - though Palestinian - relates to me as one of The Tribe.

I don't love Sweet Joanna's primarily because I can sit outside in the warm SOMA weather and see the Bay Bridge behind my friend while we take a prolonged lunch.

I *do* love Sweet Joanna's primarily because I can savor the lucious eggplant, hummus, homemade chicken, fresh vegetables and exotic blends of hearty scrumptious Mediterranean fare all via a SALAD bar!

Of course, the flirtatious proprietor never *hurts* things. But the list above really is definitive. I think.
author: Diane B.

description:
Fellow SOMA folks around Howard Street and Main, go here for one thing only and that is the ABC Turkey sandwich!  

It is this toasted sandwich that definitely filling.  The sandwich has Avocado spread, Bacon, Swiss cheese, fresh roasted turkey (ask for dark or light meat) and all the other veggies you want to add.  Tell them not to toast it too long because the bread gets to the point where it will cut up your mouth!  Bring extra napkins because juice flows out of this bad boy!!!

Only other things I have tried was the rice crispy and the macaroons, both were pretty good.  I'm not sure about that salad bar though, some of the stuff can look pretty old.
author: Jason A.

description:
Once again, my co-worker rules! 

She recommended me this place via one of her friends. I had the Philly Cheese steak and it was made to order. THe line was kinda slow though.. 15mins to wait for order and another 7 mins to cook it, but it was worth it.  

More of a to-go place, so you may not want to eat in here unless you really do not enjoy the lovely Embarcadero strip.
author: Wilson L.

description:
I work in this building and therefore eat at Sweet Joanna's often. The owners are middle eastern and the salad bar is stocked with your normal stuff...lettuce, tomatoes, eggs, cheese, broccoli, but add on top of that some yummy tomato-cucumber-feta salad, some falafel, some amaaaazing humus. It changes every day. 

Sammiches are delish, soup is always good, hot meal items like chicken or macaroni and cheese hit the spot. It's a no-fail place.

Good coffee and breakfast sammiches and croissants in the a.m.
author: Andrea S.

description: This review is for the lox sandwich, which is excellent! Piled high with fresh veggies, tons of cream cheese and lox on a toasted bagel, you're essentially getting two meals worth of food. I bought one for my breakfast and by 3pm I was still not hungry. Friendly staff and I'd love to try other items on their menu!
author: Bella L.

description:
This place is awesome. I know some of you have had trouble with the service, but I promise if you "keep in there" you'll eventually arrive in the firendly zone where the Manager (owner?), Chef, and sandwich girls will all say hello with a smile on their face. I like Sweet Jo's because they have quality fresh ingredients and they're extremely affordable for being in a city with overpriced processed crap. If you need even an even BIGGER reason to go, here's three:

1) The Turkey ABC (Avocado, Bacon, Cheese)
They cook the turkey everymorning. They're big, they're juicy, and they're oh so good. When taking people to SJ's for the first time, I always start them with this.

2) The New York Sub
Three types of meat, two types of cheese. A little... excessive, but damned good. I recomend Turkey, Pastrami, & Roast Beef with Chedder & Swiss ;-)

3) The BBQ Turkey Sandwich
Its a rariety that they actually have this but when they do, hot damn, its good eats. Fresh BBQ turkey, jalapeno bits, and all the regulars. 

I discovered them a couple years ago and go at LEAST once a week.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I come here for their falafel sandwich (sadly fried and not baked, but that doesn't stop me), their veggie burger, and their roast beef sandwich...piled high with all the jalapenos you could ask for! MMM

And credit/debit are A-OK
author: Andrea U.

description:
Really good sandwiches here.  My favorite so far has been the turkey club, which is a triple deck lightly toasted sandwich loaded with turkey, bacon, tomato, avacado, and red onion.  

It will take a while to make, but is ultimately worth it, especially if you're burnt out of Subway, Quizno's, and Toaster Oven.
author: John H.

description:
Their coffee is awful and so is their catering. I have to use them for work, but I wish I didn't have to. They always forget something I order, and almost never bring cutlery. And they've been more than 10 minutes late more than once.

One time the decaf carafe they brought was malfunctioning, and when I called them they asked me to come down and get a new one. When we ran out of the rest of the coffee the owner screamed at me: "I already gave you 3 coffees!"
"Um, yeah, but one of them wasn't working."
I had to go down and get that one, too.
author: Katie D.

description: It's a bummer that when I go in at 3 they are pretty much out of everything. Seems like they should close shop at 3 if you don't plan to have enough food to sell until you close. Options are very limited and my last two sandwiches which should of been hot came out luke warm to room temp. I don't think I will be going back.
author: Nick P.

description: Employees are friendly and the sandwiches are made with fresh ingridients. AWESOME place!
author: Sergio L.

description:
H-E-C-T-I-C.

But the sammich I got (turkey club) was generously sized and tasty.  I did have to fight for it though... tooth-and-nail style.  I mean, by the time I had gotten my sammich, I had already bitten so many other customers I had lost my appetite.  

But overall, I don't mind a little struggle for my food if I'm getting it to go.  They also had a handsome salad bar that had no line, but I like a little bloodshed before a meal.  Makes me feel more primal.  I after a while I victoriously achieved sammich ownership and got the hell out of there.  

I wanted to eat outside anyway.
author: Mari C.

description:
4 stars for having a great salad bar, really good sandwiches, yummy mac n cheese on thursdays, tasty lasagna on other days, fresh soups, super nice staff, and large bottles of orangina.

1 star gone for always putting avocado on my sandwich when I say not to. I know, I am weird and dont like avocado, but isn't it easier to just not put it on there?
author: Amanda R.

description:
This is a great place to grab lunch in the FiDi.

Food? Yummy turkey sandwich (real roasted turkey, not factory-preformed kind). Falafel sandwich is amazing, albeit a little messy.  Gyros sandwich is o.k.  The prices for the sandwiches are quite fair ($5-$6) especially for this area.

Service? The owner Amin is super friendly and so is his staff. It is, however a bit on the slower side if you get a hot sandwich like we did (gyros and turkey today).

Ambiance? The place is cute and very clean.

Verdict? Definitely would come back here if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jane A.

description: Awesome for lunch - love the salad bar! Love the owners even more- very friendly, amazing cookies, perfect!
author: Monette H.

description:
This place has the best macaroon's!  they're huge!
I'm a sucker for their philly cheese steak sandwiches.......they load them with jalapenos!
author: Rio K.

description:
I come here frequently for breakfast and lunch.... For breakfast, I love their muffins. They serve hot breakfast too, but i didn't like their breakfast burrito. The burrito was on the healthier kind, not for the  hungover who crave grease/fat and yummy goodness.  

Boy they're busy at lunch, they can't really keep up with the sandwich line. Sandwiches yum, but takes a while. The salad bar is okay, I like it for non-salad green stuff-  the falafel balls and the random hot pasta they have on the side.
author: Amy Y.

description: Been going here since 2001 since I used to work a block away from here.  How good is this place?? Well, lets just say I had them on speed dial on my work phone!!  My favorite??  Roasted Turkey (fresh bird), dark meat, on Dutch Crunch, ABC special, that's Avocado, BACON and cheese, add sprouts, lettuce, tomato, onion, jalapenos and pesto/mayo, grill it and BAMMM!!! You just got yourself an SF hidden gem.  Trust me!!
author: Alan L.

description:
I really like this place. Its one of my favorite lunchtime haunts.

I would swear by the BBQ chicken sandwich. The jalapenos on bbq sauce - yum. The meatball marinara is also quite exceptional though i try not to eat it regularly to control my ballooning weight. 

They also have food that is sold by weight.  I always see the chicken right by all the masses lining up and coughing into the tray. Not very appetizing for me. I have never tried anything other than the sandwiches there. 

Don't you think the old dude with the chef's hat is a relic from the 1800s?
author: Sarav C.

description: I work around the corner from Sweet Joanna's & love the sandwiches, salad bar, breakfast & the great service!
author: kristina m.

description: good salad bar, a bit pricy. Sandwiches are great. The owner is very friendly.
author: Jc S.

description: oh my gosh i miss this place. i used to frequent this place while i was working in the city. my favs were the pastrami sandwich, the gyro and the spinach pie. prices are good and the staff was super friendly. i would definitely go back if i were in the area!
author: Jenjen R.

description:
OH Sweet Joanna, you ARE ever so sweet. Thank you for producing the best melt-in-your-mouth turkey sandwich that I've ever had. I'm sorry I ever underestimated or prejudged you. When my co-worker said he was going to pick me up a "turkey sandwich" I had no idea it was going to be like Thanksgiving oozing and goozing and exploding all over my mouth. I can already predict the many pounds I will be gaining now that I've discovered your sweet oh so delicious existence.

I'd also like to thank you for making your sandwiches gigantic and giving me something to hope for, dream for, and live for the next day.... left overs!
author: Michelle N.

description:
Very friendly and quick (even when busy) service. Salad bar is a draw, as are the fresh paninis (at least for me). Bread seems a little stale, but turkey and cheese are good quality (no Subway here). I can't say that the food is the absolute end all be all of lunch time deliciousness, but it's definitely worth a go if you're in the neighborhood and craving something simple.

I give props to the owner and chef; two gentlemen that can always cater a last minute meeting in a flash!
author: Jenni D.

description:
Went here on a scorching hot day.  But it was worth it.  The Turkey ABC sandwich definitely was a treat as all others have mentioned.  Lots of tables and booth seating available.  Prices seemed very reasonable.  Tons of options for whatever your craving.  They have a fresh pasta bar that had pasta salads, falafel, fruit etc.

The turkey was tasty!!!!!!
author: Christopher W.

description: Huge sandwiches, well worth the money. Salads and pasta's also, cold and warm sandwiches, they also do a breakfast burrito and breakfast sandwiches. The owner is at the register Mon-Fri..plenty of seats and great views of Mission with the window seats. Muffins and some sweet's also.
author: Rose A.

description:
Not sure what the commotion is about...  it does seem to be crowded at lunch time.

Ordered a falafel and it wound up wet and soggy.  Coworker ordered a philly cheesesteak and it didn't really have any cheese in it -- guess you could say it was the healthy version.
author: case l.

description: Sweet Joanna's is a delicious treat right by my office.  I love the workers there - everyone is so nice and sweet.  Their food is always fresh and their service is quick.  If I stop in there for breakfast, I will either get a breakfast burrito or a super bagel.  The super bagel is lox, onion, tomatoe, and melted cheese but I get my mine with cream cheese instead.  If I stop there for lunch, it's either a deli turkey sandwich or the salad bar.  The salad bar is always fresh and delicious with two hot items to add to your healthy choice.  It's easy and they understand the hustle and bustle of downtown so I never wait long.
author: Arica V.

description: Pretty darn good Barbque chicken sanwiches and Hot Turkey Sanwiches. And the prices are reasonable. I had thier Hot Pastrami Sanwich- and eh I've had better. Thier cold sanwiches are pretty decent too. The buffet looks good, but buffets in general tend to scare me, as I see people's sleeves touch the other food on the table as they reach for the middle item.
author: Maria K.

description: Sandwiches are amazing! The Hot Pastrami on marbled rye is the best i've ever had. The prices are very reasonable, typically under $8 for a sando. I would give 5 stars, but their salad bar is not always that fresh.
author: Matthew W.

description:
I pass by here on the way to work. Some mornings the smell of freshly cooking corned beef is too much -- and I can't wait for lunch.  Among the many sandwich, salad and soup joints in the greater FI DI, there's lots of competition.   I think this place is among the best -- up there with Working Girls for consistent deliciousness. 

Best things here:  Corned beef, the freshly cooked turkey,  the chicken and pasta in the salad bar.  Prices reasonable, comfy surroundings.
author: James E.

description:
Uggghhhhhhh, I just finished stuffing my face with a white & dark meat roasted turkey sandwich on focaccia with bacon, swiss, and avocado... 

That. Was. Delicious.  Good call Yelpers.

I know I've only got 2 more lunch days this week but I think I might have to go back for more.  Excellent chip selection too.
author: Niall H.

description: Sandwiches are big and taste great, I have no complaints there and would have gone 4 stars for sure.  But if you order a sandwich after 12:01 you're bound to get caught in a crowd of onlookers wondering where's your order.  I've been to this place 3 times and already twice I've seen a sandwich picked up by the wrong person.  They really need to take names or numbers rather than having a soft-voiced lady whisper the name of the sandwich and hand it to the first person who makes eye contact with her.
author: Gary D.

description:
Was looking for a vegetarian caterer for a work meeting of 14 and came across Sweet Jo's online. I live in DC normally and was not familiar with restaurants in SF.  Took a change and called her for a delivery the following day and it could not have been easier to organize. I told her how many people and what the dietary needs where and she planned the perfect meal to serve! 
She dropped the hot food off right on time at the office.  
I order out for all day meetings often and the every day sandwich and pizza can get very boring so thought chili and biscuits would be a fun change and I could not have been more right! Everyone LOVED everything.  
The vegan chili was the perfect amount of thickness that even meat eaters raved about and the spiciness was just right.  The biscuits were a crowd favorite and the collard greens rival some of my personal favorite cafes from growing up in the South! The price is completely reasonable and she brought all the toppings for the chili as well as brownies for desert! 

Joanna gets 100% 5 stars in my book and will definitely be ordering from her again the next time I am in SF! Thank you, thank you, thank you Joanna I am so happy you were able to cater our meeting!!!
author: Tyler S.

description:
Sweet Joanas is a solid place to get daily lunch and breakfast stuff from.  Staff is super nice and it is pretty cheap.  Food is good, nothing to rave about, but they're not trying to reinvent the wheel.  Solid breakfast and lunch sandwiches. There muffins are pretty exceptional, I might add.  

Where they lack: coffee is a little weak.  Wish they had better quality. What they have isn't bad, but would love it if there was a cup of coffee I looked forward to rather than one I got just to get some caffeine.  

Solid staple for everyday eats.
author: anthony c.

description: Have breakfast there every Friday morning.  Great breakfast burrito and Burn's Special.  Their CA turkey sandwich with real, roasted turkey is so good for lunch, too.  Friendly, fast ... they take GoPago so order ahead of time and avoid the line ... eat there or take it away.  Love this place!
author: Roger E.

description:
I was excited to go hear after reading some rave revues.

I was really disappointed, with my sandwich the Triple decker turkey club.
It sounded good with bacon and avacado.  The Sandwich tasted bland even the bacon had no flavor.  I got a bowl of french oino soup and the did not offer chreese or crutons to go with it.  That tasted good because it was canned soup.

With all the options down here I will save my money and go some else place.
author: Matthew K.

description:
by-the-pound bars get expensive, but this is a go to for your hummus fix. small selection but all good, and main hot dishes change daily.

feels much better on your body than lee's...!
author: S V.

description: The staff is amazing. The food is delicious and quality! I love the falafel wrap. They also have delicious homemade muffins cinnamin rolls with walnuts,  scones and cookies. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are substantial.  I can usually make two meals out of one sandwich.
author: Rosa P.

description:
Best. Roast. Turkey. Ever.

I have never had such good roast turkey, and this five days after Thanksgiving.  The roast turkey sandwich with swiss was perfectly toasted and the roast turkey moist and full of flavor.
author: Chris S.

description: Fresh-squeezed orange juice!  Amin's personal service is remarkably friendly.
author: Patti L.

description:
Sweet Joannas, is a great place for Salads, Soups, and gourmet sandwiches.   The salad bar has 30 plus items ranging from fresh veggies, humos, eggs, and shrimp.   The sandwhiches are made on the finest bread.  Every day they have a daily entree.  

I did give out 4 stars, because my cheese steak sandwhich was overly salty to the point that I had to throw it away.   I did the cashier, if that does any good.
author: Robert S.

description: in the past week i been her 3 times. love this place. love the fresh roast turkey sandwich. best in town. and the girl that makes my sandwich makes it how i like it. i literally customize my sandwich every time i go there and its good every single time. if you are looking for a solid sandwich spot w/ decent pricing this is your spot.  thank you joanna.
author: Jason Y.

description: Great find for a lunch spot near the Embarcadero.  Amazing (and huge) turkey sandwiches that they heat up in the oven.  They roast a fresh turkey every day!
author: Rebecca G.

description: Oh tender turkey, baked fresh every day. Served with avocado on a toasted French roll, how sweet it is!
author: Nish N.

description: What an adorable place! A huge plus for being in SOMA and so close to my work!! I wanted to eat a little salad before my sandwich was ready, but it turned into a BIG salad. LOL! There were too many options to choose from and everything I tried was oh so yummy! The California Chicken Club that I  ordered was scrumptious! The ingredients were so fresh! My hubby ordered a sandwich with pesto in it and two seconds later he swallowed it whole because it was so good! Before we left I made sure to cheat on my zone diet and eat my weakness... a rice krispi treat. I had to get a cookie for the road too. BOTH homemade and so delightful!! Amin, the owner, is such a wonderful man. He is a genuinely happy person, his energy can be felt simply by smiling at you. Great food, great location, great people!!! I can't wait to go back!!
author: Maribel L.

description: I can't believe that I have worked down the block from SJ's for more than six months and only visited for the first time today.  The sandwiches my coworker and I split were delicious and reasonably priced.   I loved the egg salad with swiss on white bread.  The turkey (see rave reviews below) was also fantastic - especially the dijion mustard.  I will be back to sample the salad bar which also looked good.  As an added bonus - they have Diet Dr. Pepper.  Sweet, sweet Joanna's...
author: Katina M.

description: OMG.  please go here.  real turkey sammich like Thanksgiving.  chicken, eggplant too.  all stuff is great.  the real deal deli.  don't listen to the nitpicking reviews.  this place is not like the soup nazi on sienfeld, but it is bizzy at lunch.  no worries, just wait and slobber...
author: roland h.

description: You can't beat a cheap, fast, friendly lunch spot in the Financial District that has fresh roast turkey sandwiches and the freshest ingredients.  Joanna's has all this plus a salad bar.  I've tried the fresh turkey, the turkey, pastrami, and philly cheese steak sandwiches and all were excellent and had plentiful ingredients.
