My only gripe about Joanna's is the "line" to get the sandwiches, which is either to the right, the center, or a jumble.  I never seem to figure it out despite the amount of times I've been there.
author: Stephen G.

description: Haven't had a bad experience with this place. Ami is so friendly as well as the girls. THe salad is beautifully displayed but yet have to try it. They know my breakfast order (when I go in) by heart, Burns special with turkey and its ready to roll. Great muffins! Freshly baked everyday. Their burritos are awesome too- more like a really fancy burrito.
author: Dizzy B.

description:
i used to work right across the street and would come here at least once a week.  if i was seriously hungry, i'd go for the philly cheesesteak, club sandwich or chicken ABC... all incredibly satisfying (coming from someone who's not a HUGE sandwich person).

most times, i just hit the salad bar.  i have a knack for being able to go through a salad bar and come out w/ a meal that doesn't resemble a salad at all so i can appreciate that sweet joanna's includes yummy things like cheesy pasta and bbq chicken in their selections.
author: Carol O.

description:
I really like this place.  It is super convenient for all of us who work in the far off quasi soma part of the financial district .
*the staff is super friendly, especially the owner.  its a pleasure going in and chatting with him while you wait.
*they actually have an amazing lox bagel.  there is way too much cream cheese usually so you need to specifiy light, but they use a tasty smoked salmon
*everything just looks so so fresh! The chicken salad not too mayonaise-y, the produce freshly washed, awesome bread (a staple in making a great sandwich)

Definitely try this place for breakfast or lunch
author: Rachel R.

description: I've only had the salad bar (more reasonably priced than my office cafe) and is always delicious. Not a whole lot of seating and be prepared to bus your own dishes.
author: jamie j.

description:
The sandwiches are GOOD and fairly priced.  But don't plan on getting out of here quick.  The service is pretty hectic, doesn't speak good English, and takes a long time. 

Breakfast is good, and the salad bar is a decent bet.  I'd suggest arriving on the early side or the late side.  Arriving at noon may result in 20 minutes to get a sandwich, unless you just hit the salad bar.
author: Chris F.

description: If ever I return to Sweet Joanna's for a lunchtime sandwich, I will ask to hold the mayonnaise.  By the time I returned to my desk (one block away), the mayonnaise on my club sandwich had soaked through the bread, the paper wrapper and the bag!  It was a good sandwich, but man do I feel greasy.
author: Marcus C.

description: Tried the chicken ABC and it was great. Very flavorful.. big sandwich for a good price and fast service. will definitely continue to hit this place up for future lunches.
author: Alfredo N.

description: I agree with I.Y. that the baked goods are not as tasty as they appear or promise to be.  It's a really convenient location, but I find it somehow lacking.  I wish they had more original vegetarian options, tastier goodies, a bigger salad bar, better lattes, a faster oven for toasting those lackluster spinach pies...  I wish I wish I wish...
author: Andi T.

description: I used to like this place because of it's salad bar - the chef would concoct some interesting dishes - but I went yesterday and everything looked *old* (the hummus had a crust on it, for gawd's sake!) and the guy at the counter (manager? older guy...) didn't even stop his conversation with someone else or look at me when I handed him my salad and $$. And PLUS my salad weighed in at $4.61 and he rang up $4.71 on the register (making it a round total of $5.00 plus tax). I know it's only 10 cents but it's the PRINCIPLE of the thing!!! To me, half the battle of any place is The Service and if The Service SUCKS, I won't go back, no matter how good (or mediocre, in this case) the food might be. Plus...seeing the chef outside smoking doesn't always fill me with a huge amount of confidence...
author: Mi M.

description: I've given this place a couple of chances, but they just never get it right. I've had a sandwich with no vegetables, a wrong order, and once when they actually lost my order. There are plenty of better sandwich shops in the area. Go to Rincon Market or the Toaster Oven instead.
author: shawn c.

description: I like their salad bar, however they charge a bit too much and their bottled drinks are also too expensive. For these reasons, I cannot possibly give this establishment 5 stars.
author: John D.

description: This is by far the best place for lunch in the area. I love their fresh sandwiches(Turkey mmmm), salad bar, coffee, baked goods and all. Its a very friendly atmosphere and although its busy almost always, i still seem to be in and out. My friends and i get lunch here often and its always delicious. If you have yet to try this place your missing out!
author: B B.

description:
This place has the best Turkey Sandwich (California Club) i have ever had. 90% of the time, they fill my sandwich with a huge stack of turkey. Its not sliced turkey like some places, but actually stripes of fresh baked turkey. I always get mixed meat, but i think you can't go wrong with all white. Even though white meat is usually dry, the turkey is so fresh and moist it doesn't matter. Plus when the cheese melts into the nooks and crannies of the turkey its like heaven. 

You can't go wrong with a california club, but some of their other sandwiches are good. I had their BBQ sub, it was delicious and filled with BBQ sauce. It was really messy and it kinda felt greasy, but i think thats the kind of thing you expect when you get a BBQ sub. Chicken, onions, jalepenos, mushrooms, it all makes the perfect combo.

For their salad bar, its not exactly the best. Nothing really sticks out. I tried a little bit of everything, but i only really liked their pasta salads and their mushrooms. I tried that chicken under the hot plate, the flavor was good, but a little dry.

If you're craving a sandwich for about 6 bucks this is the place to go. I try and get their California Club once a week. Thats how good it is. I would pass on their salad bar.
author: David C.

description:
tried this place for lunch today. i work right around the corner and was meeting up with a friend for a quick bite to eat. i was a little worried about the line, but it went quickly and efficiently.

i had the salad bar which was stocked with lots of different goodies - various types of lettuce, pasta salads, toppings, even falafal balls! it was pretty reasonable for a large size container too. the sandwiches other customers were ordering smelled delicious and i will definetly have to come back and try them. they have tables inside and out, which was perfect for our quick little lunch catch up!
author: Jessica B.

description:
a hefty four stars! yeah, why do i give it 4 stars? because i can create and customize my own sandwiches sans the attitude from the employees. i'm a picky eater (and trust me, i'm not proud of it), but when i enter an establishment and they shrug at the sight of me... that's not a good thing for me or for them! at sweet joanna's i'm always greeted with a smile either by the guy who seems like he's one of the owners or by the sandwich makers. 

my tip: avocado chicken bacon sandwich with no avocados and add salami, hold the mayo and mustard and lots of jalapenos on the side. 

ADVISORY:
with half a sandwich, you can easily get full, but with the addicting french bread they use, you'll just keep eating til the last bite, and if you're into spicy, the last bite will include a jalapeno! one word: tums.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
I love the pastries at this place, and the plain black coffee. It is just very tasty and really strong. 

The owner Amin is a super nice guy and will chat with you if you like, if it is not too busy.  

Sweet Joanna's Cafe adds to a nice warm atmosphere in the downtown area that's increasingly dominated by chains.
author: anda a.

description: Good, solid food. Very much like homemade. Very good salad bar. Fresh. Barbecued chicken is really nice - mostly made on Tuesdays and Thursdays. There is nothing like Sweet Joanna's in the neigborhood. That is why it is pretty busy during lunch time. Highly recommend it for a quick and tasty lunch with a friend or... whoever.
author: Dima A.

description: I just had lunch there and I had to make sure I reviewed this place. I haven't been to that many cafe's in this area but of all the places I have, this is one of the best!  The cafe itself is nice, cozy and CLEAN.  They have a nice selection on the menu to fit whatever you may be in the mood for.  Everything looked so good (especially the brownies and cookies) I couldn't decide what to get.  The owner Amin helped me choose the California Club and I was VERY much satisfied!  It was nice and toasted with good quality ingredients and the sauce didn't soak all the way through the bread and the portion was good.  The people there also make the atmosphere very pleasant.  Amin and Martin are very friendly funny guys that make you feel welcome.  I would have stayed and ate more good food and had more laughs but of course I didn't want to spend more on the parking meters than the lunch.   Can't wait to go back and try something else!
author: CJ G.

description: Great breakfast burrito's, except they don't come with potato.  The menu says that the falafel's sandwiches are made with pita's, but they are actually made with the same tortilla's as the breakfast burrito's.  Other than that, not the best place for falafel's... I prefer going down the street to cafe algier's.  The spinach pie is good and cheap, but a little chewy.  They have some good deals, but service is slow.
author: Sienna l.
